item.title: 收购公司 KKR 将以 31 亿美元收购 OSTTRA
item.description: S&P Global 和 CME 集团周一宣布，私募股权公司 KKR 将以 31 亿美元收购交易后服务公司 OSTTRA。【原文：Private equity firm KKR will buy post-trade services company OSTTRA in a $3.1 billion deal, S&P Global and CME Group announced on Monday.】

item.title: 数据显示苹果第一季度智能手机销量第一
item.description: Counterpoint Research 公司周一发布的数据显示，由于 iPhone 16e 的推出以及日本和印度等国的强劲需求，苹果公司在第一季度占据了全球智能手机销量榜首的位置。【原文：Apple took the top spot for global smartphone sales in the first quarter on the back of the iPhone 16e's launch and strong demand in countries such as Japan and India, data from Counterpoint Research showed on Monday.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织称贸易紧张局势可能导致股市崩盘
item.description: 国际货币基金组织在周一的一份报告中说，包括贸易紧张局势在内的重大地缘政治风险事件会引发股价大幅调整。【原文：Major geopolitical risk events, including trade tensions, can trigger large corrections in stock prices, the International Monetary Fund said in a report on Monday.】

item.title: 调查发现，即使在特朗普发动关税风暴之前，大多数首席执行官也在怀疑自己的董事会
item.description: 周一的一项调查显示，即使在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税政策使市场和企业陷入动荡之前，全球首席执行官们就已经对董事会在他们应对不确定性时给予的支持感到不满。【原文：Even before U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs threw markets and companies into turmoil, global CEOs were already unhappy with the support they were getting from their boards of directors in navigating uncertainty, a survey showed on Monday.】

item.title: Facebook 所有者 Meta 在 Instagram 和 WhatsApp 的审判中面临生存威胁
item.description: Facebook 母公司 Meta Platforms 周一将在华盛顿面临一场高风险的审判，美国反垄断执法人员将在此案中寻求解除这两笔交易，指控其斥资数十亿美元收购 Instagram 和 WhatsApp，从而建立了非法的社交媒体垄断。【原文：Facebook parent Meta Platforms faces a high-stakes trial in Washington starting on Monday on claims it built an illegal social media monopoly by spending billions of dollars to acquire Instagram and WhatsApp, in a case where U.S. antitrust enforcers seek to unwind the deals.】

item.title: 关税暂停后，加拿大央行更有可能停止降息
item.description: 加拿大央行本周可能暂停降息周期，因为通胀上升、就业疲软以及美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对全面互惠关税的退缩降低了经济刺激的紧迫性。【原文：The Bank of Canada is likely to pause its rate-cutting cycle this week as rising inflation, weakened employment and U.S. President Donald Trump's retreat from sweeping reciprocal tariffs have reduced the urgency of economic stimulus.】

item.title: 部分电子产品关税暂缓，期货反弹，科技股大涨
item.description: 白宫豁免智能手机和电脑对中国征收互惠关税，暂时缓解了美国关键技术进口产品被征收新关税的压力，华尔街期货周一上涨。【原文：Wall Street futures rose on Monday after the White House exempted smartphones and computers from reciprocal tariffs on China, offering temporary relief to key U.S. tech imports from new levies.】

item.title: MPS 首席执行官出价收购 Mediobanca，对世界上历史最悠久的银行进行改造，接受市场考验
item.description: 今年 1 月，哈佛商学院的一群学生参观了意大利锡耶纳蒙地帕斯基银行，他们收集了一些笔记，准备就如何实现银行扭亏为盈进行案例研究。【原文：When a group of Harvard Business School students visited Italy's Monte dei Paschi di Siena in January, they gathered notes to build a case study on how to turn around a bank.】

item.title: Norinchukin 新负责人表示，日本政府债券 "在范围之内"，可作为投资目标
item.description: 日本 Norinchukin 银行新任首席执行官表示，日本政府债券（JGB）现在自然成为该行的中长期投资目标，因为通胀回升和利率提高使其更具吸引力。【原文：Japanese government bonds (JGBs) are now a natural investment target over the medium and long term for Norinchukin Bank as the return of inflation and higher interest rates have made them more attractive, its new chief executive said.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟探索公司选择不出售波兰 TVN 公司
item.description: 华纳兄弟探索公司周一发表声明称，已决定不出售波兰广播公司 TVN，这与围绕竞购过程的各种猜测划清了界限。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery has decided not to sell Polish broadcaster TVN, it said in a statement on Monday, drawing a line under speculation surrounding the bidding process.】

item.title: 英国石油公司在美国墨西哥湾沿岸发现新石油储量
item.description: 英国石油巨头英国石油公司周一表示，在美国墨西哥湾的远南油田发现了石油。【原文：BP made an oil discovery in the Far South field in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico, the UK-based oil major said on Monday.】

item.title: 华尔街预计国际货币基金组织协议将提振阿根廷市场，外汇管制将发生重大变化
item.description: 周五晚些时候，阿根廷与国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）签署了一项 200 亿美元的贷款计划，并取消了大部分货币和资本管制措施，华尔街投资者预测阿根廷市场将出现积极反应。【原文：Wall Street investors are forecasting a positive market reaction in Argentina after the country sealed a $20 billion loan program with the International Monetary Fund and undid large parts of its currency and capital controls late on Friday.】

item.title: 索尼将 PlayStation 5 在欧洲的售价提高 11
item.description: 索尼表示，由于通货膨胀率高和汇率波动，它将提高其 PlayStation 5 游戏机在欧洲、英国、澳大利亚和新西兰市场的价格。【原文：Sony said it will hike the price of its PlayStation 5 console in markets in Europe, Britain, Australia and New Zealand, citing high inflation and fluctuating exchange rates.】

item.title: 加拿大经济衰退风险上升，今年至少再降息两次：路透社民意调查
item.description: 美国主导的贸易战给加拿大带来的衰退风险日益增加，这将促使加拿大央行今年至少再降息两次，尽管大多数经济学家表示，决策者将在周三维持利率不变。【原文：Growing recession risks to Canada from the U.S.-led trade war will push the Bank of Canada to cut interest rates at least twice more this year, although a majority of economists said policymakers will leave them unchanged on Wednesday.】

item.title: 阿根廷比索：外汇体制改革后货币走向何方？
item.description: 在阿根廷，每个交易员都会问这样一个问题：星期一早上比索会值多少钱？【原文：The question on every trader's lips in Argentina: How much will the peso be worth on Monday morning?】

item.title: 韩联社：韩国认为特朗普将与首尔、日本和印度展开关税谈判
item.description: 据韩联社报道，韩国代总统韩德洙（Han Duck-soo）周一表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）似乎已指示立即开始与韩国、日本和印度就关税问题进行谈判。【原文：South Korea's acting President Han Duck-soo said on Monday U.S. President Donald Trump appeared to have directed talks on tariffs to begin immediately with South Korea, Japan and India, Yonhap News Agency reported.】

item.title: 泰国表示将于 4 月 21 日与美国讨论关税问题
item.description: 泰国政府发言人周一表示，泰国财政部长和商务部长将率团访问美国，与特朗普政府官员会面，推动减免计划中的高额关税。【原文：Thailand's finance and commerce ministers will lead a delegation to the United States to meet Trump administration officials and push for relief from planned heavy tariffs, a government spokesperson said on Monday.】

item.title: 台湾总统称美国关税谈判第一阶段 "顺利
item.description: 台湾总统赖清德周一表示，台湾与美国的第一阶段关税谈判 "进展顺利"，政府希望以此挑战为契机，推动台湾加美国的贸易新布局。【原文：Taiwan's first phase of tariff talks with the United States went "smoothly" and the government hopes to take this challenge as an opportunity to promote a new Taiwan-plus-the-United States layout for trade, President Lai Ching-te said on Monday.】

item.title: 关税豁免后苹果股价领涨科技股
item.description: 美国对主要从中国进口的智能手机、电脑和其他一些电子产品免征关税后，苹果公司的股价在法兰克福上涨超过 6%。【原文：Apple's shares rose over 6% in Frankfurt after the U.S. granted exclusions from tariffs on smartphones, computers and some other electronics imported largely from China.】

item.title: 花旗集团因关税担忧下调美国股票评级至 "中性
item.description: 花旗集团将其对美国股票的评级从 "增持 "下调至 "中性"，称预计唐纳德-特朗普总统的全面关税将影响该地区的盈利增长。【原文：Citigroup downgraded its stance on U.S. equities to "neutral" from "overweight", saying it expects President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs to impact earnings growth in the region.】

item.title: 印尼官员表示，印尼将主动增加美国进口以帮助贸易谈判
item.description: 印尼首席经济部长秘书周一表示，印尼将购买价值180亿至190亿美元的美国商品，以寻求就美国计划征收的关税进行谈判。【原文：Indonesia will offer to buy U.S. goods worth $18 billion to $19 billion as it seeks negotiations over planned U.S. tariffs, the secretary to the chief economic minister said on Monday.】

item.title: 回到俄罗斯天然气？警惕特朗普的欧盟面临能源安全困境
item.description: 在俄罗斯入侵乌克兰三年多之后，欧洲的能源安全依然脆弱。企业担心，对美国的依赖已成为另一个弱点。【原文：More than three years after Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Europe's energy security is fragile. Businesses are wary that reliance on the United States has become another vulnerability.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，意大利富豪成为长江和记港口的主要投资者
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引知情人士的话报道，意大利亿万富翁詹路易吉-阿庞特（Gianluigi Aponte）的家族企业正在成为一个集团的主要投资者，该集团正寻求从企业集团长江和记手中收购 43 个港口。【原文：Italian billionaire Gianluigi Aponte's family-run business is emerging as the lead investor of a group seeking to buy 43 ports from conglomerate CK Hutchison , Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 高盛将 2025 年底金价预期上调至 3700 美元/盎司
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）将 2025 年底的金价预期从每盎司 3,300 美元上调至 3,700 美元，预计区间为 3,650 美元至 3,950 美元，理由是各国央行的需求强于预期，以及经济衰退风险导致交易所交易基金流入增加。【原文：Goldman Sachs raised its end-2025 gold price forecast to $3,700 per ounce from $3,300, with a projected range of $3,650-$3,950, citing stronger-than-expected demand from central banks and higher exchange-traded fund inflows due to recession risks.】

item.title: Holcim 计划于 6 月分拆北美业务
item.description: 瑞士建筑材料公司 Holcim 周一表示，分拆北美业务的计划将于 6 月进行，但须在 5 月 14 日的年度股东大会上获得股东批准。【原文：The planned spin-off of Holcim's North American business should take place in June, subject to the approval of shareholders at its May 14 annual general meeting, the Swiss building materials company said on Monday.】

item.title: 瑞士山德士公司在美国对安进公司提起反垄断诉讼
item.description: 瑞士仿制药生产商山德士公司（Sandoz）周一表示，它已在美国提起反垄断诉讼，控告安进公司巩固其大片药物恩贝拉（etanercept）的市场支配地位。【原文：Swiss generic drug manufacturer Sandoz said on Monday it had filed an antitrust lawsuit in the U.S. against Amgen for entrenching the dominant market position of its blockbuster medicine, Enbrel (etanercept).】

item.title: 澳大利亚 Clorox 公司因谎称使用回收塑料被罚款 520 万美元
item.description: 澳大利亚竞争监管机构周一称，高乐氏公司在当地的分公司因谎称其 GLAD 厨房和垃圾袋部分由回收的海洋塑料制成而被联邦法院处以 825 万澳元（519 万美元）的罚款。【原文：Australia's competition regulator said on Monday Clorox's local unit had been fined A$8.25 million ($5.19 million) by the Federal Court over falsely claiming its GLAD kitchen and garbage bags were partially made from recycled ocean plastic.】

item.title: 早间竞标：关税两步走
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole】

item.title: KKR 任命大卫-彼得雷乌斯为中东业务主席
item.description: 美国私募股权公司 KKR 周一表示，已任命大卫-彼得雷乌斯（David Petraeus）为其中东业务主席，并在该地区成立了一个由朱利安-巴拉特-杜（Julian Barratt-Due）领导的投资团队。【原文：U.S. private equity firm KKR on Monday said it has appointed David Petraeus as the chairman of its middle east business, and has set up an investment team in the region under the leadership of Julian Barratt-Due.】

item.title: 台积电第一季度利润可能飙升，但特朗普政策给前景蒙上阴影
item.description: 台积电（TSMC）是全球人工智能应用领域先进芯片的主要生产商，该公司将于本周四公布第一季度利润增长 54% 的报告，但同时也可能会指出美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易政策所带来的风险。【原文：TSMC , the main global producer of advanced chips used in artificial intelligence applications, is set to report a 54% leap in first-quarter profit on Thursday, though is also likely to flag risk from trade policies of U.S. President Donald Trump.】
